Articles.Content:
I sent Greggan Kerman to the mun today, but I accidentally activated the staging while about ten meters above the ground. Fortunately, the capsule survived.

My question is, should I rescue him?
Just look at that trusting face! Of course you must rescue him, you monster!
Okay! When it's finished, I'll post the results of the rescue in the Mission Reports forum.
If you don't rescue him, at least rename the capsule 'Mun Colony One' or something equally grand. Then send him base upgrades, a rover and other toys

Quicksave

u

i

c

k

s

a

v

e
Don't see a parashute on the pod? Was it destroyed in the crash?
Yeah, rescue him. He's a significant investment in career mode, so don't waste your crew!

One of my first memorable moments in this game came when Jebediah became stranded in Munar orbit after running out of electric charge. His was my first trip to the Mun. My second trip there was with a larger ship with solar panels and a big spotlight. I EVA'd Jeb to the 2nd ship and brought him home. I still look fondly back at those screenshots; it really made me feel invested in my spaceprogram and gave me a proper sense of adventure this game can provide.

Rescue your man; he deserves it.

Quicksave

u

i

c

k

s

a

v

e

Is your handle deliberately ironic?

Rescue him when convenient. You'll need to repeat his mission anyway, whatever it was, so just send an extra seat with and try to land nearby.
Why is that even a question? No one gets left behind - learn it, love it, live by it.

Why is that even a question? No one gets left behind - learn it, love it, live by it.

This . If the crew survive a crash, live with it. Then go get them.

If YOU were stranded on Mun, should we come rescue YOU?

Of course you should go rescue him ..... if you don't, we'll see to it the powers that be defund your space program!
It's not like he's stranded on Eeloo or something. If you're playing career, you're almost certainly going to have to go back to the Mun anyway. Just combine the rescue with another mission.

If YOU were stranded on Mun, should we come rescue YOU?

Of course you should go rescue him ..... if you don't, we'll see to it the powers that be defund your space program!

Well since he did ask us if he should save his valiant kerbonaut, he has qualified himself for the "erh, let's save this for later, when we've got a bit more time and cash"-queue

I sent Greggan Kerman to the mun today, but I accidentally activated the staging while about ten meters above the ground. Fortunately, the capsule survived.

http://i57.tinypic.com/2qxujvd.png

My question is, should I rescue him?

It was your error that stranded him, not his. I would rescue him

I rescued him, and posted the screenshots on the mission reports forum.

Also, I was playing sandbox mode. I don't play career.

I almost wanted to post: Of course you should rescue him!

That's my way when doing Career.

But when I do sandbox, I'm less inclined to save Kerbals...

If YOU were stranded on Mun, should we come rescue YOU?

Of course you should go rescue him ..... if you don't, we'll see to it the powers that be defund your space program!

I accepted contracts to rescue two Kerbals - one is near Dres orbit. The second is stuck in a capsule inside Moho's orbit! I hate Moho! But i will pay a mountain of cash for a ship able to pull this rescue off, i will go there - and i will bring that poor, unlucky son of a booster back home. Because it's the right thing to do.

Rescued a kerbal orbiting between Jool and Eeloo once - a single nuke pushing an asparagus set of liquid fuel tanks and carrying a Mk1, heat shield, and an octo pod.

And in the process flunked a couple of expiring contracts waiting for that loooong orbit to finish...

Sorry, I think the correct form is:

Quicksave

You stranded him there... you need to fix it! I always quicksave before entering atmos just in case my kid hits the keyboard to i do something that wasn't mission designed. If i forget to put a chute on or run out of fuel.. dude's a pancake.

It was your error that stranded him, not his. I would rescue him

The boss doesn't make errors! Greggan just misinterpreted the instructions

I'm appalled you even questioned this!

Glad to hear you did in the end, rescue missions are often more fun anyway.

Especially when they fail too.

And you have to send another rescue mission to rescue first rescue mission.
It is actually relatively easy to retrieve him from the mun and by doing that you can practice your landing precision
